Landing the Job: Applications and Interviews for Educators
Module 1: Characteristics of Effective Resumes

Characteristics of Effective Resumes

We asked our experts,

“When you are looking through a stack of resumes, what stands out to you? What qualities do great resumes have that make you put them into the further consideration pile?”

We’ve organized their responses into the categories listed on the expanders below. Select each expander to read more and hear what our experts had to say.

As you explore the content, consider:

  • How do the responses confirm your ideas about what makes an effective resume?
  • How will you use the content of the experts’ responses to make your resume more effective?

  • Be Consise

    Our experts all agree that it’s important to keep it “short and sweet”. Please play the following short clip in which Kelly Jones, a Human Resources Director, expounds on this idea.


    Transcript

  • Be Clear

    HR professionals and administrators view many resumes and don’t have time to parse through complex or confusing language and visuals. Keep your language simple and clear. Please play the following short clip in which Walt Sutterlin, an administrator with experience as a school principal, explains.


    Transcript

  • Highlight Your Accomplishments

    Whether you are a new educator or a veteran, you certainly have classroom accomplishments to share with hiring teams. Be sure to put these front and center! To learn more, please play the following short clip featuring Alicia Ganaway, a Human Resources Director.


    Transcript
